data.title: Return to Silent Hill (teaser trailer)
data.text:
Silverhand

Oct 26, 2023

1,478

May 31, 2024

#3

Looks like a fan film.

And they couldn't have that guy dye his hair blonde? Assuming he's James.

Last edited: May 31, 2024

27,404

It just me of does that look kind of a grungy Alan Wake wondering the streets of Silent Hill?

I liked the first film, and I didn't expect theyd get the director back for this thing. I'm not like... enthusiastic or optimistic but they're at least doing something. Which is more than I expected from Konami

May 31, 2024

#13

It just me of does that look kind of a grungy Alan Wake wondering the streets of Silent Hill?

Yeah the main guy doesn't look like James to me. Having said that, what Gans said in yesterday's piece on the Transmission did sound good, like he obviously likes and appreciates Silent Hill (The first movie is pretty good to be honest), having said that, this is uhh... Maybe not that great

I actually kind of like the first movie. This one is looking rough, can't lie.

#15

Not a fan of Christophe Gans, he put so many random ideas on the first film and the rest of his filmography is pretty mid. I hope the movie doesn't look like a fan film like the trailer.

Astral

Oct 27, 2017

30,002

May 31, 2024

#16

The story alone of SH2 gives a movie like this the potential to be really damn good…if it has the right people working on it.

May 31, 2024

#17

Where is the fog, the smoke and ether, the peeling paint?

PucePikmin

Apr 26, 2018

4,095

May 31, 2024

#18

I thought the first Silent Hill flick by Gans was quite solid (I think reviewers were just knee-jerk negative about any video game movies back then). If they stick fairly faithfully to the SH2 plot, this might not be bad.

May 31, 2024

#19

It's really strange to me that they'd remake the game and make a film out of it at the same time. People will inevitably compare them and one will eventually be regarded as the worst reimagining of SH2.

As much as people seem to hate Bloober, I can't imagine this film being better received.

I hate judging it by a trailer that seems to be showing very incomplete post-production, but this is what they decided to release and it just looks rough to my eyes.

Jroc

Jun 9, 2018

6,491

May 31, 2024

#20

The first Silent Hill movie looked really nice, so I'm willing to give Gans the benefit of the doubt on the visuals front. The teaser looks like it hasn't had much post-production work in certain shots.

Story-wise I'm expecting this to be a weird bastardized version of Silent Hill 2 similar to how the original Silent Hill movie was a weird bastardized version of Silent Hill 1.

At this point I don't really care if the movie is shit since Revelation 3D already placed the bar in hell. I'm ready to enter the sick twisted world of Jacob Crane.

Chackan

Oct 31, 2017

5,218

May 31, 2024

#21

Like I said on SH2 Remake thread: this looks horrible

Looks to be on the same level of the last Silent Hill 2 movie...the one with John Snow, and that movie was simply put a BAD movie, let alone a bad SH movie.

What Are Ya' Selling?

36,858

Outside of some shoddy effects, the original film looked really good at times.

I need to see another trailer for this one lol

Is that a fan film? What is that supposed to be? Whatever it is it looks awful.

May 31, 2024

#25

18 years since the first Silent Hill film. Crazy. Remember nerding out about everything on the IGN boards during production. Apparently the eternally burning fires under the abandoned town of Centralia was a real life inspiration. I thought the first film was quite solid, re-using the game soundtrack worked wonders, and having the same director return so many years later shows that Konami and many fans are of similar understanding.

#31

I can't believe this looks like a better adaptation of Silent Hill 2 than the actual Silent Hill 2 remake. The actors, meh, but the environments, the movement of the creatures, everything is on point there.

Yup, still where I'm at with this.

Like I said on SH2 Remake thread: this looks horrible

Looks to be on the same level of the last Silent Hill 2 movie...the one with John Snow, and that movie was simply put a BAD movie, let alone a bad SH movie.

You're misremembering. Revelations was a bad Silent Hill 3 adaptation, not a bad Silent Hill 2 adaptation.

This is the first bad Silent Hill 2 adaptation (unless Bloober's remake releases first.)

5,151

London

...Gans seems to be a genuine fan and I appreciate that I guess.

But this is wholly unnecessary and is not going to be good. Might look nice, though.

Oct 25, 2017

May 31, 2024

#37

I actually kind of like the first movie. This one is looking rough, can't lie.

I think the first one is fucking great, actually.

Yeah, it's different from the games but so what, it's a solid mystery thriller flick minus some dodgy CG.

It's nice that it's getting a sequel after all this time, since it absolutely has never ever received a sequel before

May 31, 2024

#38

Should have been an animated film about cooking with Pyramid Head

dskzero

Oct 30, 2019

3,531

May 31, 2024

#39

I think the first one is fucking great, actually.

Yeah, it's different from the games but so what, it's a solid mystery thriller flick minus some dodgy CG.

It's nice that it's getting a sequel after all this time, since it absolutely has never ever received a sequel before

The original Silent Hill is genuinely a nice movie. Not the greatest thing, but it respected the source material while doing their own thing.

KDC720

Oct 25, 2017

3,562

May 31, 2024

#40

Some of the shots looked very flat to me, fan filmish. I do like James looking a bit more grungy and disheveled though, and Maria looking more artificial for lack of a better word.

That first movie was decent by the standards of early 2000's videogame adaptations but the bar was in the fucking sewer back then. It needs to better than mid.

Hoping Gans brought his A game for this, I think he at least understood the franchise better than a lot of other folks who took a crack at it even if he still got some things wrong in that first movie.

Looks alright, but i feel SH would be better as an anthology Tv show than movie adaptations.
